AAS Name: Area of Archaeological Significance

AIRCZ Type: AIRPORTDescription: Gatwick Airport Wind Turbine Consultation Zone:Contact: The Safeguarding Department, Gatwick Airport Limited, 7th Floor Destinations Place, London Gatwick Airport, West Sussex, RH06 0NP

AIRCZ Type: AIRPORTDescription: Heathrow Planning Consultation Zone: All buildings, structures, erections and works exceeding 90 metres in height (295.3 feet)Contact: The Safeguarding Department, Heathrow Airport Limited, c/o Planning Services, First Point, Buckingham Gate, Gatwick Airport, West Sussex, RH6 0NT

description: Removal of white painted timber double doors to rear and replacement with white painted timber single single doors with side fixed light and side opening casement.
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.Reason: This is required by Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.

Development  shall  be  carried  out  in  accordance  with  the  materials  specified  on  the approved plans and on the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.Reason:To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The proposals will lead to disruption to users of the highway network including the adjacent TfL and SRN in the Borough. As a result, the applicant should contact the Highway Authority at least four month prior to works commencing to obtain TfL Network Assurance approval. This is required under the New Roads and Street Works Act 1991, and the Traffic Management Act 2004, in order to satisfy the licensing requirements of the Highways Act 1980.
The fee required for your planning application is Â£103.00.  Payment can be made via either our Contact Centre on 0208 547 5002 or by cheque made payable to Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames.

Inspection:Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise with information provided by the applicant as supporting material to application.Assessment:The works would result in a well shaped tree becoming unbalanced, on this basis consent for lesser works should be permitted only allowing a holistic reduction.Recommendation:Refuse & grant lesser works as follows:T.1 Oak - 2m Holistic crown reduction to suitable growth points, crown lift to 3m from ground level all round, remove any epicormic growth & deadwood.
